What is additional Child Care Subsidy (t.answer: The Additional Child Care Subsidy (Temporary Financial Hardship) will provide short-term increased child care fee assistance to families who are experiencing significant financial stress due to exceptional circumstances, to ensure continuity of care. ... The family will not have to meet activity test requirements.

Do both parents have to work to get chil.answer: In a two parent family, both parents must meet the activity test and a family's Child Care Subsidy will be based on the parent with the lower number of hours.

Will Centrelink back pay child care subs.answer: To get Child Care Subsidy you need to submit a claim. You must be using an approved child care provider. If eligible, we'll pay the subsidy directly to your provider. If eligible, we may be able to backdate your subsidy for up to 28 days.
